reviews.review_msg: Overall this is not a difficult course if you 1) pay attention to requirements 2) communicate with your prof/TA and incorporate their feedback in your work. Prepare to write and research, a lot.   David provides detailed feedback which is on point and he is ready to answer questions. This course was a real learning opportunity.

Took Crim 343 via Distance Ed.  A proposal is due at the end of the semester, but it is broken up into 4 small papers. Dave is very friendly and gives great feedback. He is a fair marker and is always open to give suggestion on your proposal. He is always available for help via email or phone call.  I would recommend this class 100%!

I don't like Dave's teaching style, and i don't find him very helpful. He takes a long time to answer emails and his answers aren't helpful. He is slow at marking & expects you to be able to rewrite 20 pages & add in 10 more in a short time. He acts as if were all experts in Corrections when in reality the textbook is useless and we dont know much.

The class was based on papers and participation. if you want to do well in his class, get his advice by going on office hours. if you follow his feedback on papers you will get great marks. would highly recommend it for students who prefer papers over exams.

loved this course but would NEVER take a class with Dave Hunt again. Feedback seemed like he didn't even read the paper and returned papers only days before the next one is due - expecting you to edit 10-40 pages and add 10 more in an average of 3 days.  Replied to all of my emails with snarky one liners, 3 weeks later!
In terms of writing ability and style, Dave has helped me more  than any of my English instructors in college. Work hard, smart and efficiently and you should be fine in his course.

Easily the best course i've taken in my crim degree so far. David makes this one of the most enjoyable classes and although the work seems daunting everything is done in a fluid manner and his comments are SUPER helpful.

lots of work but not if you prefer essays to exams like myself. I didn't read a page of the textbooks and did great so i kinda wish i never bought the package from the bookstore. Take this class if you actually want to learn something that translates into the real world! One of the best classes i have ever taken.

I took this course online. It requires a lot of work, research, and readings; however, no exams. The professor is really helpful, fair, and provides feedback on all assignments. If you require an extension, he is very considerate. Overall, I learned a lot, was satisfied with what I learned and with my final paper, and I liked the course.

Very interesting class. Dave is super passionate with what he is doing and is very willing to help students! This is a very practical class and allow you to think outside the box. One of the best classes I have taken in my university career! Thanks Dave for the amazing learning experiences!

Dave is helpful and understanding, but his marking is a mess. Takes way too long and gives nearly everyone the same mark. The class is unlike anything else. If you're looking for a GPA boost, walk away. Only take Dave's class if you want to gain real life skills and are ready to work hard. Totally worth it, though!

The course was very informative and really helps you understand corrections in a practical way. However, although dave seems nice he was a hot mess while teaching this course, he took forever to give back the assignments, and made excuses for himself for why. He also doesn't give great marks and there is ALOT ALOT of writing (a total of 56 pages)

One of the toughest upper level CRIM courses. It's very self-directed, writing-intensive, and hard-core research-based. I do not like this course too much but Dave Hunt is THE BEST ONLINE TUTOR MARKER I have EVERRR had (& I took my fair share of DE courses at SFU). Very interactive. Truly cares about student needs. Knowledgeable. THE best TM.

The course itself, is something new, valuable but somewhat difficult and fairly self-directed.  However, David does his best to try and make sure the students understand.  He is clear and concise, and very knowledgeable. This class may be challenging but I would recommend it if you are interested in corrections.

David Hunt, hands down, the best prof/tm I have ever had in years of distance education.  He has a way of clearly communicating and helping each student to reach that AHA moment.  Wish there were more like him!

The class was interesting and very writing intensive. The teach was very helpful during the term but when asked for further help after the semester, he would not reply back to several e-mail attempts. Not a good professor is you are looking for a reference!

This course is definitely writing intensive, but the end product  is unlike anything that I have done during my post secondary schooling. While the course work appears extreme at first, it is actually divided into different sections and due dates that are clearly explained and make for a less intimidating assignment.

The class is different and unique from other crim courses, and it gives you experience that you can actually use in the real world. Dave was a great instructor and very helpful. This class requires time and interest but it definitely pays off. Dave gives lots of constructive feedback which helps the growth of your writing skills.

This course requires alot of work and alot of time but it is all worth it. Dave is an amazing instructor. He provides you with all the help you need. The course is definetly challenging but if you work really hard you will be rewarded in the end. I definetly recommend this course with Dave as an instructor.

This class looks intimidating, but Dave was awesome and did a great job explaining and helping students. No exam, but lots of research! Allows you to think in a different way and challenges you. He gives great feedback, great advice and has tons of knowledge! He's very reassuring and it quick to calm anyone's fears. Awesome guy! Thanks David!

Fantastic Prof! His feedback was always helpful and he is VERY knowledgeable in the field of corrections. Great class as well... lots of work is required to do well but this is by far the most practical class I've taken. It really helped me learn a lot. Even if it was dist ed... best prof I've had and most enjoyable class I've taken.
Provides lots of constructive feedback and is very easy to contact.

There is a lot of work required for this class but it is broken down so it is not as overwhelming as it may seem in the beginning. The workload was well worth it and I would gladly choose the format of this class rather than the standard midterm/essay/final format. Dave, you should tell CODE to have more classes like this!

Awesome teacher. Very open to feedback, and his comments on the papers are very very useful. Researching for the proposal for this class has opened a whole new world for me. Dave is very helpful, and the corrections field being his career really helps because he has so much knowledge. Note: lots and lots of work and research, but no exam!! Whoo hoo

I had him for this course distance ed, and the expectations for the assignments were not very well organized and clear at all.  He expects more critical thought on these papers but when we don't even know what the expectations are, it's pretty ridiculous.  Takes forever to mark papers and get them back to you.

I've had David for 312, 335 & 440 all via distance. Overall, he's a great teacher. I had some difficulty understanding course expectations (335). He Preaches and expects critical thought on course assignments (he's not afraid to fail below par assignments). Saying this, he's still open to novel POVs. Highly recommended.

I learned quite a lot from Crim 312 and the instructor was very accessible. He responded to feedback, had a good attitude and was very quick with his responses which is something quite rare. I really enjoyed the material covered and learned to write better papers as a result. Highly recommended. Worth the time and money.

found him to be open to feedback, helpful, and able to both give and take critique. obviously a quality prof who is trying to do right by his students. It would have been nice to see him operate within a classroom...I bet the discussion alone would be worth attending. (I took my course through distance ed)

Dave was an awesome teacher, but I've never heard of him giving anything higher than an A- (and very few of those too!). Still, he was very helpful and extremely committed to the students/course. He does expect you to work hard though!

This course was quite challenging because it has a different format. Dave's passion for the course and his willingness to assist his students in achieving a realistic proposal is very inspiring. The amount of positive and sometimes constructive feedback that I recieved from Dave has made this whole experience worth while. Thank you.
Wonderful course and exprience. Way different from anything else I've ever taken. It's great taking a class that makes you think for yourself.
No Comments
made you think about your your oppinions and attitudes towards a particular subject and help firm up your foundational viewpoints on these.
